body_content.explanation: a national park (= a large area of land protected by the government because of its natural beauty or because it has a special history) in the US state of New Mexico:
examples: Carlsbad Caverns National Park in New Mexico is home to one of America's best known caves.
Federal land managers plan to lease important wildlife habitat and land adjacent to Carlsbad Caverns National Park and the Bisti wilderness for oil and gas drilling.
